docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Consumer confusion about cholesterol prevails as the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute swings into a campaign to get everyone's blood cholesterol tested and, if it is too high, reduce it to a less heart-damaging level. Consider, for example, these cases involving typical consumers:

headline.main: Wellsburg Journal; A Quest for 'Wellness' in a Fat Town

byline.original: By B. DRUMMOND AYRES Jr., Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Charles Bell figured the program was working when his butcher told him that beef sales were way off.
